title: Rabbit, Porchetta Style
introduction: Imagine the savory flavors of traditional roast pork, now applied to tender rabbit. This recipe hails from the Marches region, where wild fennel is a popular ingredient. With a delightful mix of pancetta, garlic, and aromatic herbs, this dish brings a unique twist to your table.
ingredients: 1 rabbit (2 1/2 to 3 pounds), cut into 8 pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Rinse the rabbit pieces and pat them dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

In a skillet large enough to hold the rabbit pieces in a single layer, heat the oil over medium heat. Place the pieces in the pan. Scatter the pancetta all around. Cook until the rabbit is browned on one side, about 8 minutes.

Turn the rabbit and scatter the garlic, rosemary, fennel, sage, and bay leaf all around. When the rabbit is browned on the second side, after about 7 minutes, add the wine and stir, scraping the bottom of the pan. Simmer the wine for 1 minute.
Cook uncovered, turning the meat occasionally, until the rabbit is very tender and coming away from the bone, about 30 minutes. (Add a little water if the pan becomes too dry.)
Discard the bay leaf. Transfer the rabbit to a serving platter and serve hot with the pan juices.
variations: Substitute the rabbit with chicken pieces for a different take on this dish.
Use boneless pork loin instead of rabbit for a more traditional porchetta flavor.
